IV.ii.2.B.2.b
.
Definition:  Static Disability
A
static disability
is a disability that is considered permanent by its nature, history, and severity.  It is assigned a permanent evaluation without the need for future examinations to determine whether or not it has improved.
title: M21-1, Part IV, Subpart ii, Chapter 2, Section B - Failure to Report for Review Examinations
citation: Part IV, Subpart ii, Chapter 2, Section B
